What a weekend...

On Tuesday it was Kimmie's birthday, so of course the JACT crew had to celebrate. Her actually birthday was Tuesday so we couldn't party yet because people had class. On Wednseday, however, Terrell came in from Jacksonville to stay for the rest of the weekend at my place. So, that night we invited everyone over to my place for a bit of a "pot-luck" dinner. We tried to watch Dave Chapelle's Block Party...but we failed. About half way through, we kept making random stupid jokes and lost all focus on the movie. Then on Saturday we had another Moore meeting. I was glad to see that we had a really good turnout...over 20 people! That's damn good for the summer. Most of these people were new so I hope they come back in the future. After the meeting, we went over to Matt's place to celebrate Kimmie's b-day. Nicole came all the way from home so it was good to see her. There was pizza, DIRT CAKE, and gifts galore. It was pretty fun, especially....CVS in pajamas, DDR in pajamas, Blackjack, Old Fish, Go Maid!....good times. In the morning, Terrell made everyone breakfast and we went our seperate ways.

All in all it was a good weekend of madness. I was going to rant about something that's been bugging me but maybe I will do that later.

Well the summer session has started for us all so I guess I should update to go along with it. Things have kind of gotten off to a weird start with me on a personal level but that is where it shall stay. Anyway, I started my 1 speech class on Wednseday morning at 8AM! Waking up early will take some getting used to I suppose, but the class is easy to stay awake in because it's basically a discussion class - hence the "speech" element. The other reason comes by way of the fact that there are only 6 of us in the class so we just sit in a little circle like a group of friends. The teacher is a young graduate student named Rebecca (I don't remember the last name), and she seems pretty nice. I am just glad that the summer is starting off light for me, especially with what is about to happen this weekend. 

Now onto that...after two semesters of unsanitary conditions, I am finally moving out of this apartment. Over the past two semesters I have been living with this guy who has only 10% of his sight left. He is a really nice guy but he is horribly unsanitary...leaving raw meat on the stove, cooked chicken and rice on the floor....EXPLODED SODA IN THE FREEZER, and old grease in the drawers? GROSS! I tried to get the room changed near the end of the Spring semester because I didn't ask for a renewal but they gave me one anyway. At that time, they told me there were no rooms avaliable for the summer. This later turned out to be a lie. What happened was that because I have a disability, I can only stay in rooms with accomidations...but I don't need that stuff. My disability has no direct hinderance on how I live my daily life sans the ability to drive. Anyway, when the summer rolled around, we got a new roommate. This roommate is completely blind and partially deaf. So in turn, I have become the "babysitter" of the apartment. I woke up this morning and took a shower, when I came back into my room I heard a glass fall. Apparently, the new guy had knocked over a PITCHER of water onto the floor. Of course, all of the water went into my area, getting under my groceries and old computer parts. NOT GOOD! So I went down to University Housing, and after basically pleading and reasoning with them, they switched me to a normal room without the accomidations crap. Therefore, this weekend, I will be making the move over to another building. Hopefully, since it is the weekend, I will have some help from friends because I have ALOT of junk. 

I guess that is the big news to speak of.

In other news, I picked up Brain Age for the DS. It's pretty neat. All the DS functions work out perfectly (technically speaking), and I found myself having odd bits of fun with it. I love things that are innovative and thought provoking (literally). When I first started it said my Brain age was 76 and that it should be at 20. This means that my brain is tired and lazy. Sounds about right to me :). 

Also got to hang out with Jaime, which was lots of fun!

I guess that's about it for now. I should probably start getting ready for bed since I have to get up around 7 for class so...TA!

Wow...it sure has been some time since I took the time to write in this thing. Alot has happened over the past few months but I have just never gotten up the energy to write it all out. I guess I can give a bit of an update...for those that still read this.

Media Productions:
Well, I finally got into my major. I applied for the second time in February and over Spring Break, I found out that I made it in. I start classes this Summer but more on that later. It seems like it's going to be a fun major because the courses are all things that I like doing or things that I want to learn. 

Spring Break:
Spring break was alright. I was originally planning to go with Laura to her parents place and then to see a concert in Tampa over that week. Turns out her parents didn't want me to come. They don't seem to like me as much as I had hoped. So, I went home to MD. It was alright I suppose. I did the normal stuff I did when I was still living there. Saw everyone, including some unexpected meetups. All in all it was a relaxing break and the news of my acceptence into the major was refreshing.

Next Semesters:
Summer 06-
I will be staying for the whole summer this year, mainly because I am behind in coursework and I need to do at least one summer semester to graduate. Here is what I am taking...

Session B - first half of summer
SPC2600 - Public Speaking - Required for graduation and my major. The only really drawback to this class is that on Monday and Wednseday, I have to be there at 8 to 10...gross.

Session C - Second half of summer
FIL2000 - Elements of Film - This should be a fun class because it's exactly what it sounds like.
RTV3104 - Narrative Writing in Film and TV - I am looking foward to this class because I want to improove my writing skills, especially with JACT: The Motion Picture on it's way to production.
This session will be fun but kind of long class wise. On Wednseday specifically, I have class from 11:25 until 7:25PM.....gross.

Fall 06:
JPN3930 - Japanese Lit in English - I am taking this class for fun. Yasuhara-sensei is teaching it so it should be interesting.
JPN220 - Int Reading and Conv. (aka Japanese III) - Not much I can say about this one except that I have a different teacher than I am used to. Should be interesting.
RTV3221 - Single Cam Production - Now we are getting to the fun stuff.
RTV3263 - Video Post Production - My most anticipated because I like Post production work.

The good thing about Fall classes is that I have NO classes on Friday and only ONE class on Monday and Wednseday. The price I pay for this is class on Tues and Thurs from 9:45-4:50 with only a half hour break.


Laura:
Why would I make a seperate column for my girlfriend? I suppose because being with her is a major part of my life. I love her to death and she is my reason for living. I think that's good enough reason. We are going on 6 months coming up in May and things are well enough. We have some small spats, but I think that has to do with the fact that we are around each other 24/7. Another strange issues that has come into play is that I have begun to have personal issues based after my past in MD. It wasn't until recently that I realized that I have a major issue in trusting people. Don't get me wrong, I trust Laura, but it seems that she is the only person I have really felt that I can trust. I suppose in my mind it's an aspect that I can't accept because I am used to being fucked over. I am working to better myself in this situation and I hope that it doesn't turn bad. If I lose Laura, I will have lost a part of my self. I just hope she knows how much I truly love her - even to the point that I can't describe with words. She completes me and without her I would be empty.

I guess that's about it for now. I will try to update this more later, and not delay so much.

I was told I had a solid course set, I would have a good chance of getting into the program- being a transfer student, I would be able to graduate in 2007. When I didn't make it into the program for this fall, I was upset to say the least...I was suddenly lost. Almost without warning, I would up as an English major. It was a fallback that I was unsure of then and am unsure of now. Also, now that I have gotten to take a step back from the College of Communication, I notice how mediocre it is in comparison to FSU's main strengths. So now I am here, stressed out as all fuck, juggling 5 drastically different courses, and empty handed with new material for my re-application for the MP program that is less intriguing that it was 2 years ago. All of this has simply gotten me wondering. Is it worth it to continue my education at FSU when I am taking courses that I could be taking elseware, for less money, and closer to home. Let's weigh the Pros and Cons...

FSU:
Pros-
All around top school that would look good on a resume.
New friends that I have grown to care about.
JACT - friends, and a relaxing hobbie that keeps me sane.
Outstanding Florida Disability Program both financially and academically - and they get the job done!
Cons-
$500 per credit hour - about $8,000 a semester.
Tiresome and expensive trips to and from home.
The original reason for enrolling is now blurred.

In State MD School (or closer (VA, DE, NY):
Pros-
Closer to home, friends, and most importantly Adrienne.
In state tuition is MUCH MUCH cheeper locally.
I can take my time in graduating and not feel guilty about the fees.
John's Hopkins - prooven best resource for my eyesight.
Cons-
Marylands Disability services are pathetic - they are all assholes.

Of course there is more to life than a pro/con list; I know that. I don't know... Maybe it's just the stress or lack of sleep, but it just seems that I can't get through a solid semester here without having these similar type doubts. I'm just starting to wonder if I just don't belong at FSU, like this is some "sign" or whatever that this isn't where I need to be. I don't know anymore...I just don't know...

Ok, so tonight I had to work and bring in the "shipment". I find myself thinking alot when I do this. Tonight I was racing around in my mind the various meanings of the words "dork" and "nerd". I thought alot about how it would be interesting to find a catagorization for each and to develop a standard for each......yeah shipment was REAL fun. Anyway, such thought brings into question....What is a dork? What is a nerd? What are the various levels of each? 

I've come up with a few examples and possible labels for each:

You are a low level DORK if you.....

Like videogames occasionally, slide the mind slightly into foreign forms of entertainment, know the difference between RAM and ROM, get excited about E3, or work in a videogame/movie/music store.

These people, inclding myself, ARE low level DORKS.

You are a mid level DORK if you.....

Play videogames, occasionally watch foreign entertainment, know the difference between a gigabyte and a megabyte, know what C++ is, have dorky friends, listen to classical music, or know the release date for Halo 2.

These people, including myself, ARE mid level DORKS.

You are a high level DORK if you...

Play RPGs, watch alot of foreign entertainment, read Manga, listen to Videogame music, listen to Anime music, have more than 2 next-gen consoles, know the difference between JAVA and VisualBasic, know the release date for the next version of Windows, or occasionally enjoy Japanese candy.

These people, including myself, ARE high level DORKS.

You are an UBER DORK (the ultimate in dorkiness) if you....

Play many RPGs, play MMORPGs, play CHAT RPGs, Interact on message boards, use LiveJournal, Watch and collect ANIME, watch and collect foreign entertainment, eat Pocky, quote anime, COSPLAY, Collect videogame and/or anime music, own/or run your own dedicated server, cry at the end of a videogame, go to LAN parties, speak in 1337, know what 1337 means, or play D&D.

These people.......including myself....ARE UBER DORKS!

Okay, now I know that I have left some details out. Keep in mind that it IS nearly 2 AM and I DO have to work tomorrow morning. Nonetheless, one must realize that there are also certain off center levels of Dorks...as follows....


If you watch hentai, or cry at the end of an RPG, you are what we call...

The Sexually Frustrated Dork


If you keep tabs of your collections in computer programs IE: DVD Profiler, you are what we call...

The Overzealous Dork


If you cry over the loss of a saved game or character in an MMO game, you are what we call...

The Lonely and Dependent Dork


Let it also be noted that these offshoots are simply different branches of ones true dorkiness.

This catagorization must also remind us that it is not BAD to be a dork. In fact, with the constant growth of the internet, one may find that it is quickly becoming "cool" to be a dork. With that said, one may question whether or not it is good to be a dork or not. Many true dorks have become so because they did not consider themselves part of the "cool" status and were found best suitable for a life apart from the human norm. Whatever the case, I am a dork and if you are reading this so are YOU, but that's A-OK by me!

What's not good is being a NERD. It's not bad to be a nerd either, however, it is quickly replacing the past standing of DORK. Because of this current status, the position of NERD can be simply described within one simple explination.

You are a NERD if you...

Play Collectible Card Games (Star Wars CCG, Yu Gi Oh!), write NPC scripts, write in C++, become sexually eroused by perfect lines of code, desire to play "MULTIPLAYER REG-Edit", Host LAN parties, or have fantasy sword fights in your backyard.

These people, suprisingly NOT me, are NERDS.


Well now that I have cleared that up for everyone, consider yourself more educated then when you first signed on.
